brownbutter1: You are a woman in every sense of the word and you deserve to be. Fuck the disbelievers, you are a woman. With or without makeup, with or without the hair or the clothes or the curves, you look like a woman. Because you are a woman. Period. ❤️❤️❤️
jennyscradle: I thank my friend @aarsi_02 for introducing me to you. You really are a role model. @ind0ctrination thank you for validating what I feel about transitioning. I used to be so open to the world. I used to almost walk with a tag in my forehead that says "trans" to make sure everyone know. But i noticed, it made my dysphoria even worse. Because then a lot of people would ask me questions I am not okay to discuss.. . Like genitals and stuff, and people then starts claiming I am distinguishable. See I grew up hating myself, my body, my life. I was suicidal. I didn't care about my own life because I thought I didn't deserve to live. But transition gave me new hopes and dreams. It made me felt right to be alive. Although I am still living with anxiety and depression, now I have the drive to fight to live. You're right, we all have the right to be visible and invisible in the unsafe world and we can always switch between those. I chose to be invisible to people I don't know and be visible to people I care about. People I feel safe with. 🙏
pervaldezsassmania: Someone who confidently says they would identify you as trans is speaking through their bias of already knowing who you are. Considering Cis women get misgendered or bullied all the time because they don't look "feminine" enough simply because feminity is such an arbitrary standard that changes from the perspective of person to person, I think this applies just as much to trans people as well. This probably won't help a lot with dysphoria, but maybe it will help filter out less than helpful comments from people around you. All strength to you. PS: you look beautiful everyday.
medhawi_kriti: Those who tell you this are idiots and you have been my woman-crush since the first time I chanced upon your account! You are so damn beautiful, inside and outside❤️

thewallflower13: So what if you'd still look different than other cis woman. The fact remains that you aren't a cis woman, then why must you be expected to look like one?? Wouldn't trying to look like an ideal cis woman be just another dysphoria you will feel shackled within?? And i say an ideal cis woman because there are cis woman who look remarkably androgynous without being trans. We as a society should work towards normalising trans women and being comfortable with them rather than expecting trans women to look and behave like cis women. You're a beautiful and elegant woman. Also this feeling of not being enough is an issue that most humans face in many different ways, although I will agree that the sad reality is that some battles are more understood than the others....

madrashe: Hey there. I'm an absolute stranger, I know. But let me tell you this. You are one of the most beautiful women I've ever come across. Trans or cis aside. You had the courage to choose to be yourself and that is pure inspiration to all of us here. Those who can't understand the courage or be able to muster up the basic strength it takes to accept the unknown will always find ways to criticize and bully it down. Doesn't make what you chose anything short of being a Queen. Remember. It is not your job to open their eyes. They are not your circus, not your monkeys. Not unless they have the basic courtesy to at least listen to you sans any judgement. None of these unknown unimportant people matter. You matter. You are the sun and the moon and the universe. Hugs. Power to you woman. (PS. Boobs and hair don't make a woman. Even if she were bald and flat chested, your mom will still be a woman right? You are a woman cos you choose to be one. And that is as legit as it gets.)
